item.title: I like this idea
item.content:encoded:
Some conferences, as you note, will be more amenable to this than others. But it's hard to argue that kids will be less mature than a lot of programmers at coding conferences. And if it's a duller conference, having activities oriented towards kids, but related to the conference purpose somehow is culture building.

Boise Code Camp had added an entire Youth Track that occurs as part of the conference, and it has been a huge success.

item.title: Bringing the kids, eh?
item.content:encoded: I only recently began my CS journey, so I haven't even attended a conference myself yet, but this sounds like a great idea! I have three kids also, and they are also well-behaved. Maybe time spent away doesn't need to be time spent apart, which is a great sell.
